channel.title: Make a non hamachi server without port forwarding
channel.description:
PartOne:
1. Open your Internet Browser. (Firefox. Internet Explorer.) 2. Go to DynDNS.Com and create and account if you don't already have one. 3. Log In, and click on the "Services" tab. 4. Now, Click on Dynamic DNS. 5. Click on Create Host. 6. Fill out the fields. Leave everything default except wildcard. Make sure it's checked. 7. Click add host, and your done with part one.
PartTwo:
1. Go to Start. Then Run. 2. Type. C:\Windows\System32\Drivers\Etc\ 3. This will open a folder, Click on Host.file and open it with Notepad/Wordpad. 4. At the end of the file add the following.
CODE 127.0.0.1 (Dynamic DNS) (Internal IP) (Dynamic DNS) (External IP) (Dynamic DNS)
Dynamic DNS = The DNS you just created at DynDNS.Com
Internal IP = Your IP of the computer you are running the server on, This can be found by going to Start, then Run. Typing in CMD, once the Windows command Prompt opens type in "ipconfig". You will get a readout the one you are looking for is "Ip Address" it normally starts with 192.
External IP = You outbound ip assigned by your ISP. You can find this by visiting whatsmyip.org
1. Go to cmd and type in Ipconfig 2. Copy your Default Gateway Ip to your browser. 3. Go to Advance Settings and login. Or even it will say it. Find portforwarding anyway. 4. Add ports such as 3306... and add your listenport which is located in your server files in ACCServer - config.
Then your done.

item.title: Make a non hamachi server without port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @dary3113 dary3113
item.description:
@dary3113 wrote:

PartOne:

  1. Open your Internet Browser. (Firefox. Internet Explorer.)
  2. Go to DynDNS.Com and create and account if you don’t already have one.
  3. Log In, and click on the “Services” tab.
  4. Now, Click on Dynamic DNS.
  5. Click on Create Host.
  6. Fill out the fields. Leave everything default except wildcard. Make sure it’s checked.
  7. Click add host, and your done with part one.

PartTwo:

  1. Go to Start. Then Run.
  2. Type. C:\Windows\System32\Drivers\Etc\
  3. This will open a folder, Click on Host.file and open it with Notepad/Wordpad.
  4. At the end of the file add the following.

CODE
127.0.0.1 (Dynamic DNS)
(Internal IP) (Dynamic DNS)
(External IP) (Dynamic DNS)

Dynamic DNS = The DNS you just created at DynDNS.Com

Internal IP = Your IP of the computer you are running the server on, This can be found by going to Start, then Run. Typing in CMD, once the Windows command Prompt opens type in “ipconfig”. You will get a readout the one you are looking for is “Ip Address” it normally starts with 192.

External IP = You outbound ip assigned by your ISP. You can find this by visiting whatsmyip.org

  1. Go to cmd and type in Ipconfig
  2. Copy your Default Gateway Ip to your browser.
  3. Go to Advance Settings and login. Or even it will say it. Find portforwarding anyway.
  4. Add ports such as 3306… and add your listenport which is located in your server files in ACCServer - config.

Then your done.
